availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Campbell (Paducah, State Congressman, Lawyer and Judge)

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Petersburg, Virginia, native. Son of James Campbell. Married to Mary Given Campbell in Livingston County on September 15, 1830. Father of Florence Campbell, Bettie Campbell, Caroline Campbell, and James Campbell. Studied law under William T. Barry. Attorney in Hopkinsville, Kentucky. Moved to Salem, Kentucky in 1829. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in the 1820s and 1830s. Served as the State Attorney. Formed a Railroad Company in Paducah with L. M. Flournoy and William Norton in 1852. Attorney in Paducah in 1860.

ab.bibl:
